summary: This is a series of emails from September 2020 among US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel discussing logistics for a meeting with victims of Jeffrey Epstein. The meeting is a requirement from the Department of Justice's settlement in the CVRA litigation, intended to review the findings of OPR's investigation. The emails focus on updating the victim contact list and coordinating FBI participation.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who was previously informed about the upcoming victim meeting. Appears to be part of the team in the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Bekah
persons.context: Has been in touch with ODAG coordinating the victim meeting and shared lessons from previous victim meetings.

persons.name: Stacie
persons.context: Person from the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) who is coordinating the victim meeting. The email suggests reaching out to her and FBI victim services.

persons.name: John
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the email author could raise the issue of FBI attendance at the victim meeting with directly.

persons.name: Sean
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the email author could raise the issue of FBI attendance at the victim meeting with directly. Also referenced as someone an interested party 'S' should be in touch with regarding meeting logistics.

connections.description: Have been in touch regarding coordinating the victim meeting, with Bekah sharing lessons from previous meetings.
The email chain discusses coordinating victim lists and meeting logistics between the US Attorney's Office and the FBI's victim services.
ODAG is setting up a victim meeting as part of a settlement and is requesting assistance from the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Planned Victim Meeting in DC
events.description: The Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) is planning a meeting with victims of Jeffrey Epstein in Washington, D.C., likely within 3-4 weeks of September 2020. The meeting is a requirement of the DOJ's settlement in the CVRA litigation to explain and review the findings of OPR's investigation.

events.title: Nolle Proceeding
events.description: Reference to a 'nolle proceeding' that occurred in August 2019, which involved a list of victims. This appears to be a prior legal event related to the Epstein case.

locations: Southern District of New York (implied jurisdiction)
keyFacts: The Department of Justice (via ODAG) is organizing a victim meeting as part of its settlement in the CVRA (Crime Victims' Rights Act) litigation related to the Epstein case.
The purpose of the meeting is to explain and review the findings of an OPR (Office of Professional Responsibility) investigation.
Officials are taking steps to minimize the likelihood of substantive victim interactions or statements during the meeting, offering private discussions with FBI agents instead.

There is an effort to update the victim contact list, acknowledging that additional victims have been identified since August 2019 and that the FBI victim services likely has a more comprehensive list.

The communication reveals inter-agency coordination between the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG), and the FBI regarding victim outreach.
